Package com.linecorp.armeria.common.logging

Interface RequestLog

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AttributeMap
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultRequestLog
    public interface RequestLog
extends AttributeMap
    A set of informational properties collected while processing a Request and its Response. The properties provided by this class are not always fully available. Check the availability of each property using isAvailable(RequestLogAvailability) or availabilities(). Attempting to access the properties that are not available yet will cause a RequestLogAvailabilityException. Use addListener(RequestLogListener, RequestLogAvailability) to get notified when the interested properties are available.
    See Also:
    RequestContext.log(), RequestLogAvailability, RequestLogListener

      Adds the specified RequestLogListener so that it's notified when all of the specified RequestLogAvailabilitys are satisfied.

      Adds the specified RequestLogListener so that it's notified when all of the specified RequestLogAvailabilitys are satisfied.

      • context

        RequestContext context()
        Returns the RequestContext associated with the Request being handled. This method returns non-null regardless the current RequestLogAvailability.

      • id

        default RequestId id()
        Returns the RequestId. This method is a shortcut to context().id().

      • method

        default HttpMethod method()
        Returns the method of the Request. This method is a shortcut to context().method(). This method returns non-null regardless the current RequestLogAvailability.

      • path

        default String path()
        Returns the absolute path part of the Request URI, excluding the query part, as defined in RFC3986. This method is a shortcut to context().path(). This method returns non-null regardless the current RequestLogAvailability.

      • decodedPath

        default String decodedPath()
        Returns the absolute path part of the current Request URI, excluding the query part, decoded in UTF-8. This method is a shortcut to context().decodedPath(). This method returns non-null regardless the current RequestLogAvailability.

      • query

        @Nullable
default String query()
        Returns the query part of the Request URI, without the leading '?', as defined in RFC3986. This method is a shortcut to context().query(). This property is available regardless the current RequestLogAvailability.

      • requestStartTimeMicros

        long requestStartTimeMicros()
        Returns the time when the processing of the request started, in microseconds since the epoch.
        Throws:
        RequestLogAvailabilityException - if this property is not available yet

      • requestStartTimeMillis

        long requestStartTimeMillis()
        Returns the time when the processing of the request started, in milliseconds since the epoch.
        Throws:
        RequestLogAvailabilityException - if this property is not available yet

      • requestStartTimeNanos

        long requestStartTimeNanos()
        Returns the time when the processing of the request started, in nanoseconds. This value can only be used to measure elapsed time and is not related to any other notion of system or wall-clock time.
        Throws:
        RequestLogAvailabilityException - if this property is not available yet

      • requestFirstBytesTransferredTimeNanos

        long requestFirstBytesTransferredTimeNanos()
        Returns the time when the first bytes of the request headers were transferred over the wire. For a client, this is the time the client sent the data, while for a server it is the time the server received them. This value can only be used to measure elapsed time and is not related to any other notion of system or wall-clock time.

      • requestEndTimeNanos

        long requestEndTimeNanos()
        Returns the time when the processing of the request finished, in nanoseconds. This value can only be used to measure elapsed time and is not related to any other notion of system or wall-clock time.
        Throws:
        RequestLogAvailabilityException - if this property is not available yet

      • requestDurationNanos

        long requestDurationNanos()
        Returns the duration that was taken to consume or produce the request completely, in nanoseconds.
        Throws:
        RequestLogAvailabilityException - if this property is not available yet

      • requestLength

        long requestLength()
        Returns the length of the request content.
        Throws:
        RequestLogAvailabilityException - if this property is not available yet

      • requestCause

        @Nullable
Throwable requestCause()
        Returns the cause of request processing failure.
        Returns:
        the cause. null if the request was processed completely.
        Throws:
        RequestLogAvailabilityException - if this property is not available yet

        Throws:
        RequestLogAvailabilityException - if this property is not available yet

      • responseFirstBytesTransferredTimeNanos

        long responseFirstBytesTransferredTimeNanos()
        Returns the time when the first bytes of the response headers were transferred over the wire. For a client, this is the time the client received the data, while for a server it is the time the server sent them. This value can only be used to measure elapsed time and is not related to any other notion of system or wall-clock time.

      • totalDurationNanos

        long totalDurationNanos()
        Returns the amount of time taken since the Request processing started and until the Response processing ended. This property is available only when both RequestLogAvailability.REQUEST_START and RequestLogAvailability.RESPONSE_END are available.
        Throws:
        RequestLogAvailabilityException - if this property is not available yet

      • channel

Channel channel()
        Returns the Netty Channel which handled the Request.
        Returns:
        the Netty Channel. null if the Request has failed even before a connection is established.
        Throws:
        RequestLogAvailabilityException - if this property is not available yet

SSLSession sslSession()
        Returns the SSLSession of the connection which handled the Request.
        Returns:
        the SSLSession, or null if the Request has failed even before a TLS connection is established.

      • host

        @Nullable
@Deprecated
default String host()
        Deprecated.
        Do not use this method. Get the remote or local address from context() or get the authority from authority().
        Returns the host name of the Request.
        Returns:
        the host name. null if the Request has failed even before a connection is established.
        Throws:
        RequestLogAvailabilityException - if this property is not available yet

      • authority

        default String authority()
        Returns the authority of the Request.
        Returns:
        the authority. "?" if the Request has failed even before its headers are properly constructed.
        Throws:
        RequestLogAvailabilityException - if this property is not available yet

      • status

        default HttpStatus status()
        Returns the status of the Response.
        Returns:
        the HttpStatus. HttpStatus.UNKNOWN if the Response has failed even before receiving its first non-informational headers.
        Throws:
        RequestLogAvailabilityException - if this property is not available yet

      • statusCode

        default int statusCode()
        Returns the status code of the Response.
        Returns:
        the integer value of the status(). 0 if the Response has failed even before receiving its first non-informational headers.

      • requestHeaders

        RequestHeaders requestHeaders()
        Returns the RequestHeaders. If the Request was not received or sent at all, it will return a dummy RequestHeaders whose :authority and :path are set to "?", :scheme is set to "http" or "https", and :method is set to "UNKNOWN".
        Throws:
        RequestLogAvailabilityException - if this property is not available yet

      • requestContent

        @Nullable
Object requestContent()
        Returns the high-level content object of the Request, which is specific to the SerializationFormat.
        Returns:
        RpcRequest for RPC, or null for others
        Throws:
        RequestLogAvailabilityException - if this property is not available yet

      • requestContentPreview

        @Nullable
String requestContentPreview()
        Returns the preview of response content of the Request. Note that the content preview needs to be enabled when configuring a Server or a Client to use this functionality.
        Returns:
        the preview, or null if preview is not available or disabled.
        Throws:
        RequestLogAvailabilityException - if this property is not available yet.
        See Also:
        ServerBuilder.contentPreview(int), ServerBuilder.requestContentPreviewerFactory(ContentPreviewerFactory), VirtualHostBuilder.contentPreview(int), VirtualHostBuilder.requestContentPreviewerFactory(ContentPreviewerFactory), AbstractClientOptionsBuilder.requestContentPreviewerFactory(ContentPreviewerFactory), AbstractClientOptionsBuilder.contentPreview(int)

      • rawRequestContent

        @Nullable
Object rawRequestContent()
        Returns the low-level content object of the Request, which is specific to the SerializationFormat.
        Returns:
        ThriftCall for Thrift, or null for others
        Throws:
        RequestLogAvailabilityException - if this property is not available yet

      • requestTrailers

        HttpHeaders requestTrailers()
        Returns the HTTP trailers of the Request.
        Throws:
        RequestLogAvailabilityException - if this property is not available yet

      • responseHeaders

        ResponseHeaders responseHeaders()
        Returns the non-informational status ResponseHeaders. If the Response was not received or sent at all, it will return a dummy ResponseHeaders whose :status is "0".
        Throws:
        RequestLogAvailabilityException - if this property is not available yet

      • responseContent

        @Nullable
Object responseContent()
        Returns the high-level content object of the Response, which is specific to the SerializationFormat.
        Returns:
        RpcResponse for RPC, or null for others
        Throws:
        RequestLogAvailabilityException - if this property is not available yet

      • rawResponseContent

        @Nullable
Object rawResponseContent()
        Returns the low-level content object of the Response, which is specific to the SerializationFormat.
        Returns:
        ThriftReply for Thrift, or null for others
        Throws:
        RequestLogAvailabilityException - if this property is not available yet

      • responseContentPreview

        @Nullable
String responseContentPreview()
        Returns the preview of response content of the Response. Note that the content preview needs to be enabled when configuring a Server or a Client to use this functionality.
        Returns:
        the preview, or null if preview is not available or disabled.
        Throws:
        RequestLogAvailabilityException - if this property is not available yet.
        See Also:
        ServerBuilder.contentPreview(int), ServerBuilder.responseContentPreviewerFactory(ContentPreviewerFactory), VirtualHostBuilder.contentPreview(int), VirtualHostBuilder.responseContentPreviewerFactory(ContentPreviewerFactory), AbstractClientOptionsBuilder.responseContentPreviewerFactory(ContentPreviewerFactory), AbstractClientOptionsBuilder.contentPreview(int)

      • responseTrailers

        HttpHeaders responseTrailers()
        Returns the HTTP trailers of the Response.
        Throws:
        RequestLogAvailabilityException - if this property is not available yet

      • toStringRequestOnly

        String toStringRequestOnly()
        Returns the string representation of the Request, with no sanitization of headers or content.

      • toStringRequestOnly

        String toStringRequestOnly​(Function<? super HttpHeaders,​?> headersSanitizer,
                           Function<Object,​?> contentSanitizer)
        Returns the string representation of the Request. This method is a shortcut of: 
        
 toStringRequestOnly(headersSanitizer, contentSanitizer, headersSanitizer);
        Parameters:
        headersSanitizer - a Function for sanitizing HTTP headers for logging. The result of the Function is what is actually logged as headers.
        contentSanitizer - a Function for sanitizing request content for logging. The result of the Function is what is actually logged as content.

      • toStringRequestOnly

        String toStringRequestOnly​(Function<? super RequestHeaders,​?> headersSanitizer,
                           Function<Object,​?> contentSanitizer,
                           Function<? super HttpHeaders,​?> trailersSanitizer)
        Returns the string representation of the Request.
        Parameters:
        headersSanitizer - a Function for sanitizing HTTP headers for logging. The result of the Function is what is actually logged as headers.
        contentSanitizer - a Function for sanitizing request content for logging. The result of the Function is what is actually logged as content.
        trailersSanitizer - a Function for sanitizing HTTP trailers for logging. The result of the Function is what is actually logged as trailers.

      • toStringResponseOnly

        String toStringResponseOnly()
        Returns the string representation of the Response, with no sanitization of headers or content.

      • toStringResponseOnly

        String toStringResponseOnly​(Function<? super HttpHeaders,​?> headersSanitizer,
                            Function<Object,​?> contentSanitizer)
        Returns the string representation of the Response. This method is a shortcut of: 
        
 toStringResponseOnly(headersSanitizer, contentSanitizer, headersSanitizer);
        Parameters:
        headersSanitizer - a Function for sanitizing HTTP headers for logging. The result of the Function is what is actually logged as headers.
        contentSanitizer - a Function for sanitizing response content for logging. The result of the Function is what is actually logged as content.

      • toStringResponseOnly

        String toStringResponseOnly​(Function<? super ResponseHeaders,​?> headersSanitizer,
                            Function<Object,​?> contentSanitizer,
                            Function<? super HttpHeaders,​?> trailersSanitizer)
        Returns the string representation of the Response.
        Parameters:
        headersSanitizer - a Function for sanitizing HTTP headers for logging. The result of the Function is what is actually logged as headers.
        contentSanitizer - a Function for sanitizing response content for logging. The result of the Function is what is actually logged as content.
        trailersSanitizer - a Function for sanitizing HTTP trailers for logging. The result of the Function is what is actually logged as trailers.
